content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(input::String; text_width::Int=10)
    output = ""
    current_width = 0
    for word in split(input)
        if current_width + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            output *= "\n$word "
            current_width = length(word) + 1
        else
            output *= "$word "
            current_width += length(word) + 1
        end
    end
    return output
end

# Example
wrapped_text = wrap_string("Julia is a high-level, high-performance programming language", text_width=15)
println(wrapped_text)
```
Example output:
```
Julia is a 
high-level, 
high-performance 
programming 
language 
```
